intro: Heteropterys macrostachya var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the rounded-leaf huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, rounded leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
